item.title: Run PostgreSQL using Private Registry
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Using private Docker registry KubeDB supports using private Docker registry. This tutorial will show you how to run KubeDB managed PostgreSQL database using private Docker images. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using minikube.
